item.title: Comment on TS2688 with TypeScript, React Native, and MobX by Michael Foltz
item.dc:creator: Michael Foltz
item.description:
looks like it's an issue with mobx 3.6.x I ran into the same error and tried compiling on 3.5.1 and it doesn't throw the error. I've posted an issue in the mobx repo. Thought I'd give you a heads up.
cheers, foltz
item.content:encoded:
looks like it’s an issue with mobx 3.6.x I ran into the same error and tried compiling on 3.5.1 and it doesn’t throw the error. I’ve posted an issue in the mobx repo. Thought I’d give you a heads up.

cheers,
foltz

item.title: Comment on Flutter Demo application linking to BoardGameGeek.Com’s Hot Game List by Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/2224/comment-page-1#comment-63886">Michael Thomsen</a>.
Thanks for the comment Michael and suggestion. It's better, but I still find it too noisy and it takes too much vertical space. Lines starting with child: or children take away the focus of the type of child or children.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Michael Thomsen.

Thanks for the comment Michael and suggestion. It’s better, but I still find it too noisy and it takes too much vertical space. Lines starting with child: or children take away the focus of the type of child or children.

item.title: Comment on Flutter Demo application linking to BoardGameGeek.Com’s Hot Game List by Michael Thomsen
item.dc:creator: Michael Thomsen
item.description:
Hi, Flutter team member here just offering a few comments.
First of all, thanks for the write up. We really do appreciate feedback!
About the formatting concerns, are you aware of how trailing commas affect automatic formatting? See the details here: https://flutter.io/formatting/#using-trailing-commas
I would also recommend splitting long build methods using some local variables.
Finally, we are working on support for optional new/const (a new feature in Dart 2).
When I combine these three techniques, I get this (which was auto formatted): https://gist.github.com/mit-mit/dccc56a94faf49a5070eee09f19e6865
WDYT?
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Flutter team member here just offering a few comments.

First of all, thanks for the write up. We really do appreciate feedback!

About the formatting concerns, are you aware of how trailing commas affect automatic formatting? See the details here: https://flutter.io/formatting/#using-trailing-commas

I would also recommend splitting long build methods using some local variables.

Finally, we are working on support for optional new/const (a new feature in Dart 2).

When I combine these three techniques, I get this (which was auto formatted):
https://gist.github.com/mit-mit/dccc56a94faf49a5070eee09f19e6865

WDYT?

item.content:encoded: didn’t work. connectors clean. totally dead. contacted fitbit. no help.

item.title: Comment on Fitbit Flex, dead and won’t charge? by Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1933/comment-page-1#comment-45777">christian</a>.
It's not on the fitbit itself. It's in the charging cradle near the bottom of the back. Just a small round hole.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to christian.

It’s not on the fitbit itself. It’s in the charging cradle near the bottom of the back. Just a small round hole.
